column3: Sign appearing in tile in front of the Castle
column4: Currently the number showing the Castle's level sits on the tile in front of it.
column5:
1. Enter City View
2. Make sure there is nothing built on the tile directly in front of the Castle
column6: The sign should not appear in the tile when there is nothing built.

column4: Tavern - "Available Spy". This is fine when there is 1 single spy available but when there are zero or more than one, it should say "Available Spies"
column5:
1. Enter City View
2. Tap on the Tavern
column6: Agreed to show "Available spies" no matter the amount.

column4: I was creating an Alliance and has "Zassa" as the name, "Zas" as the label and had only entered "ABC" as the description. I clicked Create and it gave me an error to say that the name must be at least 4 characters in length. I couldn't clear this until I added a 4th character to the description. I think the description is triggering the the name validation error.
column5:
1. Tap Alliance from the footer.
2. Tap "Create Alliance"
3. For the name enter "Zassa"
4. For the label enter "ZAS"
5. Enter "ABC" in the description.
6. Tap "Create"
column6: The alliance should be created successfully.

column4: When setting the alliance tag, the heading says "Enter name".
column5:
1. Tap Alliance from the footer
2. Tap Set Tag

column3: Alliance name and tag leading with number
column4: Potential issue with having an Alliance Name or Alliance Tag leading with a number. Throws up an error to say must be 4 characters or over (which is really wrong for the tag, as it can only be 3 characters)
column5:
1. Tap alliance from the footer
2. Tap Set Alliance Name
3. Purchase and use Alliance Renamer
4. Enter a new name, leading with a number
5. Tap OK
6. Tap Set Tag
7. Purchase and use Alliance Tag Renamer
8. Tap OK
column6: At points 5 and 8, it should be possible to have alliance names and tags save with leading numbers.

column4: When using a speed up to speed up the time it takes to train troops, the number of troops owned in the barracks, does not update until you exit and re-enter the barracks.
column5:
1. Enter City View
2. Enter the Barracks
3. Train some troops
4. Do not leave the Barracks screen and wait for the training to be complete
column6: When the training is complete, the number of troops listed in the barracks should increase by the amount selected to train.

column4: There are no graphics, apart from cities showing in world view.
column6: Lakes, hiils, desserts, Cities, Villages, etc. should all show.

column4: In World View the header icon buttons are colourless
column6: The headers for bookmarks, jump to own city, etc. should all show in colour.

2. Tap on a blank tile
3. Look for the Stable description
column6: In the description, "Calvary" should be changed to "Cavalry"
